{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|num=1|1=
polymorphic_allocator() noexcept;
}}
{{dcl|num=2|1=
polymorphic_allocator( const polymorphic_allocator&amp; other ) = default;
}}
{{dcl|num=3|1=
template&lt; class U &gt; 
polymorphic_allocator( const polymorphic_allocator&lt;U&gt;&amp; other ) noexcept;
}}
{{dcl|num=4|1=
polymorphic_allocator( std::pmr::memory_resource* r );
}}
{{dcl end}}

Constructs a new {{tt|polymorphic_allocator}}.
@1@ Constructs a {{tt|polymorphic_allocator}} using the return value of {{c|std::pmr::get_default_resource()}} as the underlying memory resource.
@2,3@ Constructs a {{tt|polymorphic_allocator}} using {{c|other.resource()}} as the underlying memory resource.
@4@ Constructs a {{tt|polymorphic_allocator}} using {{c|r}} as the underlying memory resource. This constructor provides an implicit conversion from {{c|std::pmr::memory_resource*}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|other|another {{tt|polymorphic_allocator}} to copy from}}
{{par|r|pointer to the memory resource to use. May not be null}}
{{par end}}

===Exceptions===
@4@ Throws nothing.

=== Notes ===
Copying a container using a {{tt|polymorphic_allocator}} will not call the allocator's copy constructor. Instead, the new container will use the return value of {{tt|{{rlp|select_on_container_copy_construction}}}} (a default-constructed {{tt|polymorphic_allocator}}) as its allocator.
